Can I use the `verus` command to send a JSON-RPC request to a Verus node?

No, the `verus` command is not used to send a JSON-RPC request to a Verus node. Instead, it is used to interact with a local Verus node. To send a JSON-RPC request to a Verus node, you would use a tool like `curl`, as shown in the third example.

Examples:
> verus listsinceblock 
> verus listsinceblock "000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad" 6
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listsinceblock", "params": ["000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
